Race.SpecificTitle: Mound FPD No. 1 -- $125.00 Service Charge - BOC - 5 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
MOUND FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT NO. 1
(SERVICE CHARGE)

SUMMARY:  AUTHORITY FOR MOUND FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT NO. 1 OF THE PARISH OF MADISON, STATE OF LOUISIANA, TO COLLECT A $125.00 ANNUAL SERVICE CHARGE FOR 5 YEARS, FOR PAYING THE COSTS OF FIRE PROTECTION SERVICES IN AND FOR SAID DISTRICT, INCLUDING THE COST OF ACQUIRING, OPERATING AND MAINTAINING EQUIPMENT AND FACILITIES NECESSARY FOR SUCH FIRE PROTECTION SERVICES.
Race.FullText:
Shall Mound Fire Protection District No. 1 of the Parish of Madison, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy and collect an annual service charge of One Hundred Twenty Five Dollars ($125.00) to be assessed persons owning each residential or commercial structure, whether occupied or unoccupied, located wholly or partly within the boundaries of the District, for a period of five (5) years, beginning with the year 2008 and ending with the year 2012 (an estimated $13,500 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the service charge for an entire year) for the purpose of paying the costs of fire protection services in and for the District, including the cost of acquiring, operating and maintaining equipment and facilities necessary for such fire protection services, and, for purposes of assessing and collecting said service charge, owners shall be assessed a service charge for each such structure which they own, and each residential or commercial unit and each housing unit within a multiple dwelling structure shall be considered a separate structure, and a mobile home, as defined in R.S. 9:1149.2(3), shall be considered a structure, provided that persons owning mobile homes shall be assessed eighty percent (80%) of the service charge, all as provided in Section 1502.4 of Title 40 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended?
